H0.text: Circulatory, excretory, and respiratory are the human body systems that work directly together to allow locomotion.

H1.text: Circulatory, endocrine, and reproductive are the human body systems that work directly together to allow locomotion.

H2.text: Skeletal, muscular, and nervous systems work directly together to allow locomotion.

H3.text: The skeletal, digestive, and respiratory systems work directly together to allow locomotion.

A4.text: Together with the skeletal system in the human, it forms the musculoskeletal system, which is responsible for the movement of the body.

A5.text: The muscular systems in vertebrates are controlled through the nervous system although some muscles (such as the cardiac muscle) can be completely autonomous.
